net.hudup.core.data

Class DataDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.data.DataDriver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public final class DataDriver
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    DataDriver is the final class representing specific data types such as system file or database. Currently, DataDriver represents Derby database, system file, ftp file, http file, network file, Microsoft SQL Server database, MySQL database, Oracle database, PostgreSQL database. The constructor of DataDriver receives input as a data type with note that data type is defined as Enum class #DataDriver.DataType. Each data type has a name. For example, the name MySQL database is "mysql". Each data type is associated with a Java driver class. For example, MySQL database is associated with the driver class "com.mysql.jdbc.Driver". DataDriver supports many methods to process data type.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      static class  DataDriver.DataType
      DataDriver.DataType is Enum class that represents data type such as Derby database, system file, ftp file, http file, network file, Microsoft SQL Server database, MySQL database, Oracle database, PostgreSQL database.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Getting name of data type. This method converts the data type represented by Enum class DataDriver.DataType into a name. For example, the data driver for Derby engine database has name "derby".
        Returns:
        Name of data type

      • loadDriver

        public void loadDriver()
        Loading driver which is its inner class name. In current implementation, it call getInnerClass() method.

      • getDefaultPort

        public int getDefaultPort()
        Getting the default port of driver protocol. For example, the default port of MySQL database is 3306.
        Returns:
        Default port of driver protocol

      • isFlatServer

        public boolean isFlatServer()
        Indicating whether the data driver has flat structure and server. For example, FTP is flat structure server. The default implementation of this method is the same to isFlatStructure(DataType) because the local file system is considered as serve now.
        Returns:
        Whether data driver is flat server

      • isHudupServer

        public boolean isHudupServer()
        Indicating whether the data driver is supported by Hudup server. For example, Hudup protocol is supported by recommendation server.
        Returns:
        Whether data driver is recommendation server

      • isDbServer

        public boolean isDbServer()
        Indicating whether the data driver is supported by database management system (DBMS) server. For example, MySQL protocol is supported by DBMS server.
        Returns:
        Whether data driver is DBMS server

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Indicating whether the data driver is valid where the valid driver is associated with the valid driver class returned by getInnerClass().
        Returns:
        Whether data driver is valid

        port - Specific port of URI

      • isCompressed

        Parameters:
        uri - Specific URI
        Returns:
        Whether URI is compressed storage unit

      • create

        public static DataDriver create(xURI uri)
        Creating DataDriver from URI. For example, given a URI "jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/hudup", the data driver is "mysql". Please see xURI for more details about URI.
        Parameters:
        uri - Specific URI
        Returns:
        Data driver from xURI

      • createSubURI

        public static xSubURI createSubURI(xURI uri)
        Extracting the sub path of specific connection URI. For example, given a connection URI "jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/hudup", the sub path is "mysql://localhost:3306/hudup".
        Parameters:
        uri - Specific URI
        Returns:
        Sub path of specific connection URI, specified by xSubURI

      • createByInnerClass

        public static DataDriver createByInnerClass(java.lang.String className)
        Creating DataDriver from the associated class name. For example, given an associated class name "com.mysql.jdbc.Driver", the returned data type is "mysql".
        Parameters:
        className - Associated class name
        Returns:
        Data driver from third-party class name

      • createByInnerClass

        public static DataDriver createByInnerClass(java.lang.Class<?> driverClass)
        Creating DataDriver from the associated real class. For example, given an associated class com.mysql.jdbc.Driver.class, the returned driver type is "mysql".
        Parameters:
        driverClass - Specific driver class
        Returns:
        Data driver from driver class

      • createByName

        public static DataDriver createByName(java.lang.String name)
        Creating DataDriver from the specific name. For example, the method returns a DataDriver of MySQL database from the specific name "mysql".
        Parameters:
        name - Specific name
        Returns:
        Data driver from name
